alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Camden (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following counties...Atlantic, Camden, and Gloucester. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 127 PM EDT, the gauge along the Great Egg Harbor River at Folsom remains just above flood stage. The water level at this gauge is falling, and it should drop below flood stage later this afternoon or early this evening. - For Great Egg Harbor at Folsom: At 1:15pm the stage was 6.03 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
